alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 06 at 3:21PM MDT until July 06 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Billings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Sheridan County in north central Wyoming... * Until 400 PM MDT. * At 320 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles north of Fort Phil Kearny Historical Site, or 9 miles south of Sheridan, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail, along with very heavy rain. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Big Horn, Story and Banner. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
